title: Can we make Yasuo's Wind Wall breakable?
body:
Because, as amusing as it is, I want my 5/0 ADC (that I have spent the past 15 minutes protecting and feeding) to be able to do something other than play "ring-around-the Wind-Wall" with a low health Yasuo until he stacks up enough Q's to kill them. 

I don't care it has 2000 health, and its health refreshes after not taking damage for 0.5 seconds. A champion shouldn't be able no-sell an most of a team by pressing W.

EDIT: I have seen a lot of people saying that you can't break wind. I would like to remind these people that wind cannot usually annihilate things that come into contact with it... unless it's dense enough to form a black hole, in which case you have other, more important things to be worrying about.

EDIT 2: Tornadoes, Hurricanes and the like fo not annihilate things, they throw things around violently.

replies.body: its technically broken if you walk through it or move to the side of it tbh
And cue everyone's favorite game: Ring-Around-The-Wind-Wall. Can you kill the Yasuo before he can get his 3rd Q off and Ult you to death? Let's find out!
If you're away from him and not in his face technically he needs to cross over his windwall to attack you doe

I'm sorry, your reply contains too much of the following:

- logic

Please rephrase your comment and try again.

Y is for yasuo, 

W is for wind wall 

A for adc


YW  A

Typical situation

Yasuo would need to be

W YA     in order to attack the adc

if yasuo is retreating then  in order for the adc to attack yasuo they should be

YW  A

Yasuo is retreating so the position would be

Y     AW

If you were opposed to me I hope you understand now.

But then .5 sec later, it's 

AWY 

because Yasuo used his E on the adc or a minon/monster to get back on the other side of his windwall.  They're also close enough for Yasuo to attack the adc now without retaliation for another .5 - 1 sec.
I didn't mention minions or e cooldown but it's possible. Also depending on the actual in game locations it can vary.

If Yasuo E'd onto the adc and they didn't even get so low as to be forced back, he already seriously messed up.  The fact of the matter is Yasuo has the tools to win in nearly any situation, even when behind.
No he was actually saying your statement was logical, but... nevermind...
i dont get why braums and actual support breaks after the first hit, yet yasuo can block for the entire duration
Different champions are different. Why doesn't Braum need 3 stacks on his ultimate to knockup ppl?
Because his knock-up is on his ultimate and actually has a CD and costs mana?
But it is on demand, easier to hit, and is a much bigger aoe?
Easier to hit than Yasuo's EQ?  Somehow I doubt that.
If yasuo eqs the radius becomes extremely/pretty small
Actually, the radius is greater, and you're literally on/adjacent to your target.  It just doesn't travel out from him, making it harder to hit 5 people with it.
It's a large line and the other one is a small circle doe

The circle is roughtly the size of Cho'gath's Q, maybe larger.  It is also centered on your position as he used his E targetting you.  The only way you're dodging that is if you preemptively use a dash/blink (assuming your champion has one) or flash.

And is on demand while Yasuo needs to have a target knocked up first and then stick to it because ultimate damage alone is low af.
Mate,we're comparing knock-ups not ultimates.
You're also forgetting that Braum takes damage after it breaks. But being able move the wall **TOTALLY** makes up for the fact that it costs mana and causes him to take damage.

It does actually. It's much easier to protect people with it in the end. Also he's pretty tanky... so he doesn't really feel anything. And in the end they are 2 completely different champions so their walls should be adjusted accordingly to each.

Fair enough. They are very similar, and rather unique skills, and thus a comparison between the two is inevitable. However, they are for two very different champions, one a tanky support, and the other a high damage high skill-cap damage dealer (assassin? I can't remember all the exact terms for champ categories.) and as such, you'd expect one to be more fragile than the other.
I would like to add that I break wind all the time

why cant your adc just accept that hes not going to 1v1 that yasuo and just kite back away from the wall where the yasuo isnt protected?

yes, the guy probably looked like a very juicy kill on 100 health or however low the amount was. but one of the most important things for beginners to learn in this game is to accept that sometimes people get away on low health and let them go. instead of chasing after them like a mindless drone, or trying to duel a yasuo 1v1 as a ranged champion around his windwall.

Very much this. The game _is not_ designed so that everyone can 1v1 each other in a fair duel where the victor is the one with more kills or skills (though those are often the determining factor anyway). Yasuo is a skirmisher and as such has strong defense abilities that he can and must use to win fights and put out high damage and that's exactly what he does. He's not supposed to be easy to kill by everyone one on one (or sometimes even two on one), especially not by ADCs.

Yeah but it's also EASY for him to kill anyone else, if it's 1v1, because he has 14th highest base ms, he always buys zeal items so he gets even more speed, also because of that his shield also synergizes with it, he has infinite dash, which is complimented by his fucking movement speed in case there's no minions around and I could go on and on, but you get it... Also his kit is overloaded af, but I think you know it yourself already.

TL;DR everything about him is overloaded, the only way to win against good yasuo is to have a team which isn't full of idiots, and pray that they don't throw all abilities at the same time so yasuo can't block all of them.

If you and your fed adc get killed by a low hp Yasuo in the time of a windwall the problem is yours.

I'm a support, I have poop for damage. ADC's are squishy, meaning that a Yasuo's AA,Q,Ult,AA,Q can practically 100-0 them.  When the Yasuo keeps walking through the Wall the second you get to same side as him makes it almost impossible to get an auto off, and good luck telling your ADC to back off when he's 1-2 auto's from death, especially if they're fed. And you know that if you back off for too long, he'll dash through the wall to a jungle camp and get away.
Nobody has had a problem with Yasuo's wind wall for the past 2 years, now everybody's crying about how it's op. L2p.
yasuo's windwall had been considered one of the most cancerous ability ever since release.

I think that there are other issues with his wind wall rather than it needing to be breakable.

The fact that he can use it very late and still block projectiles as it spawns from the center of Yasuo. Sometimes, even at certain points you can use it last second pointed in the wrong direction from you and it will still block things is a little bit bogus.  Also in order to remove the effects of Windwall you either need to cross the threshold of it and essentially putting yourself in a position to be dashed through to the other side or wait it out and hope that he's not so low he's just going to run.

There's also points with the windwall that seem to block projectiles that it shouldn't. 

The biggest issues I have with Yasuo is that even if you do outskill him, his kit is loaded enough that he can make up for it...

If I land CC on him as he lands his Q on me. My CC can end after I've gotten back to the ground, but he still has time to ult me. This isn't really fair as I should be rewarded heavily for landing CC on him, especially during his combo. This isn't a one off thing this is something that happens frequently.

Yes, but making it durable instead of invincible would make it so that he can't just 'nope' most(?) champions for 4 seconds. And make it that much more difficult for him to get a kill 1v5 because there were too many ranged champs on the non-Yasuo team.

Making it breakable wouldn't really do that much. 

I think it's better off being a shorter duration than breakable. They made Sivir's spellshield a shorter duration so she couldn't "hold your spells hostage." They hit the duration of her spellshield and that did a lot to ensure it was used at the right time.
He can ruin entire compositions with a good W, and win a team fight with it, easily.
it should not be that wide. it should not last that long and it should only block from one direction to punish yasuos that can't aim a wall correctly
